sections.heading: defendant; right to counsel.At a felony defendant's first appearance before a court, the court shall advise him or her of the right to court-appointed counsel if he or she is indigent
sections.text: If he or she asserts indigency, the court shall make a reasonable inquiry to determine his or her financial conditio

sections.heading: defines indigency and along with this section requires the court to make a reasonable inquiry as to a defendant's financial condition
sections.text: To determine indigency the court must consider the seriousness of the offense; the defendant's income; the availability of other resources, including real and person
